name: Robert Pattinson
description: Renowned British actor known for roles in the Twilight saga and The Batman.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Robert Pattinson was born on May 13, 1986, in London, England. He developed a passion for acting during his school years and began his professional career at a young age. Pattinson gained initial recognition through theatre performances and minor television roles.

content.title: Career
content.body: Pattinson's breakout role came with his portrayal of Cedric Diggory in *Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire* (2005). However, he gained worldwide fame for his role as Edward Cullen in the *Twilight* saga (2008-2012), which became a global phenomenon. His career further diversified with performances in indie films like *Good Time* (2017) and acclaimed projects such as *The Lighthouse* (2019). In 2022, Pattinson starred as the titular character in Matt Reeves' *The Batman*, showcasing his versatility and depth as an actor.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Pattinson has frequently collaborated with prominent filmmakers like Christopher Nolan, having appeared in *Tenet* (2020). He also worked with directors such as David Cronenberg in *Cosmopolis* (2012) and *Maps to the Stars* (2014), consistently challenging himself with diverse roles.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Robert Pattinson has established himself as a versatile and talented actor, earning critical praise and a broad fanbase. He has been recognized with numerous awards, solidifying his status as one of his generation's leading talents.
